trans-unit.source: Constructing the Shared Access Signature URI
trans-unit.target: Constructing the Shared Access Signature URI

trans-unit.source: The URI for a shared access signature includes components that specify the resource to make accessible, the interval over which the shared access signature is valid, the permissions associated with the signature, an optional access policy identifier associated with the request, and the signature itself.
trans-unit.target: The URI for a shared access signature includes components that specify the resource to make accessible, the interval over which the shared access signature is valid, the permissions associated with the signature, an optional access policy identifier associated with the request, and the signature itself.

trans-unit.source: The following figure represents the parts of the shared access signature URI.
trans-unit.target: The following figure represents the parts of the shared access signature URI.

trans-unit.source: Required parts appear in orange.
trans-unit.target: Required parts appear in orange.

trans-unit.source: The parts of the URI are described in the subsequent sections.
trans-unit.target: The parts of the URI are described in the subsequent sections.

trans-unit.source: Specifying the Signed Version Field
trans-unit.target: Specifying the Signed Version Field

trans-unit.source: The <parameterReference>signedversion</parameterReference> field contains the service version of the shared access signature.
trans-unit.target: The <parameterReference>signedversion</parameterReference> field contains the service version of the shared access signature.

trans-unit.source: This value specifies the version of shared access authentication used by this shared access signature (in the <parameterReference>signature</parameterReference> field), and also specifies the service version of requests made with this shared access signature.
trans-unit.target: This value specifies the version of shared access authentication used by this shared access signature (in the <parameterReference>signature</parameterReference> field), and also specifies the service version of requests made with this shared access signature.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="cc4fba5c-7015-40bf-a29c-b6f0c684ff3c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Versioning for the Azure Storage Services</link> and <link xlink:href="2279856c-ff44-4560-bfa5-b03ae644c0af" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure Storage Services Versions 2013-08-15 and Earlier</link> for information on which version is used when to execute requests via a shared access signature.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="cc4fba5c-7015-40bf-a29c-b6f0c684ff3c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Versioning for the Azure Storage Services</link> and <link xlink:href="2279856c-ff44-4560-bfa5-b03ae644c0af" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure Storage Services Versions 2013-08-15 and Earlier</link> for information on which version is used when to execute requests via a shared access signature.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="98f3411e-d85d-4be9-809e-135b3d4ed436" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Delegating Access with a Shared Access Signature</link> for details about how this parameter affects authentication of requests made with a shared access signature.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="98f3411e-d85d-4be9-809e-135b3d4ed436" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Delegating Access with a Shared Access Signature</link> for details about how this parameter affects authentication of requests made with a shared access signature.

trans-unit.source: Field name
trans-unit.target: Field name

trans-unit.source: Query parameter
trans-unit.target: Query parameter

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Required and only allowed in versions 2012-02-12 and newer.
trans-unit.target: Required and only allowed in versions 2012-02-12 and newer.

trans-unit.source: The storage service version to use to authenticate requests made with this shared access signature, and the service version to use when handling requests made with this shared access signature.
trans-unit.target: The storage service version to use to authenticate requests made with this shared access signature, and the service version to use when handling requests made with this shared access signature.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="cc4fba5c-7015-40bf-a29c-b6f0c684ff3c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Versioning for the Azure Storage Services</link> and <link xlink:href="2279856c-ff44-4560-bfa5-b03ae644c0af" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure Storage Services Versions 2013-08-15 and Earlier</link> for information on which version is used when to execute requests via a shared access signature, and how clients executing the request can control the version using the <parameterReference>api-version</parameterReference> query parameter or the <parameterReference>x-ms-version</parameterReference> header.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="cc4fba5c-7015-40bf-a29c-b6f0c684ff3c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Versioning for the Azure Storage Services</link> and <link xlink:href="2279856c-ff44-4560-bfa5-b03ae644c0af" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure Storage Services Versions 2013-08-15 and Earlier</link> for information on which version is used when to execute requests via a shared access signature, and how clients executing the request can control the version using the <parameterReference>api-version</parameterReference> query parameter or the <parameterReference>x-ms-version</parameterReference> header.

trans-unit.source: Determining the Version of a Legacy Shared Access Signature Request
trans-unit.target: Determining the Version of a Legacy Shared Access Signature Request

trans-unit.source: In legacy scenarios where <parameterReference>signedversion</parameterReference> is not used, the Blob service applies rules to determine the version.
trans-unit.target: In legacy scenarios where <parameterReference>signedversion</parameterReference> is not used, the Blob service applies rules to determine the version.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="cc4fba5c-7015-40bf-a29c-b6f0c684ff3c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Versioning for the Azure Storage Services</link> for more information about these rules.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="cc4fba5c-7015-40bf-a29c-b6f0c684ff3c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Versioning for the Azure Storage Services</link> for more information about these rules.

trans-unit.source: Client software might experience unexpected protocol behavior when using a shared access signature URI that uses a storage service version that is newer than the client software.
trans-unit.target: Client software might experience unexpected protocol behavior when using a shared access signature URI that uses a storage service version that is newer than the client software.

trans-unit.source: Code that constructs shared access signature URIs should rely on versions that are understood by client software that makes storage service requests.
trans-unit.target: Code that constructs shared access signature URIs should rely on versions that are understood by client software that makes storage service requests.

trans-unit.source: Specifying the Signed Resource (Blob Service Only)
trans-unit.target: Specifying the Signed Resource (Blob Service Only)

trans-unit.source: The <parameterReference>signedresource</parameterReference> field specifies which resources are accessible via the shared access signature.
trans-unit.target: The <parameterReference>signedresource</parameterReference> field specifies which resources are accessible via the shared access signature.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes how to refer to a blob or container resource on the URI.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes how to refer to a blob or container resource on the URI.

trans-unit.source: Field name
trans-unit.target: Field name

trans-unit.source: Query parameter
trans-unit.target: Query parameter

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: Specify <userInput>b</userInput> if the shared resource is a blob.
trans-unit.target: Specify <userInput>b</userInput> if the shared resource is a blob.

trans-unit.source: This grants access to the content and metadata of the blob.
trans-unit.target: This grants access to the content and metadata of the blob.

trans-unit.source: Specify <userInput>c</userInput> if the shared resource is a container.
trans-unit.target: Specify <userInput>c</userInput> if the shared resource is a container.

trans-unit.source: This grants access to the content and metadata of any blob in the container, and to the list of blobs in the container.
trans-unit.target: This grants access to the content and metadata of any blob in the container, and to the list of blobs in the container.

trans-unit.source: Specifying the Signed Resource (File Service Only)
trans-unit.target: Specifying the Signed Resource (File Service Only)

trans-unit.source: SAS is supported for the File service in version 2015-02-21 and later.
trans-unit.target: SAS is supported for the File service in version 2015-02-21 and later.

trans-unit.source: The <parameterReference>signedresource</parameterReference> field specifies which resources are accessible via the shared access signature.
trans-unit.target: The <parameterReference>signedresource</parameterReference> field specifies which resources are accessible via the shared access signature.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes how to refer to a file or share resource on the URI.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes how to refer to a file or share resource on the URI.

trans-unit.source: Field name
trans-unit.target: Field name

trans-unit.source: Query Parameter
trans-unit.target: Query Parameter

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: Specify <userInput>f</userInput> if the shared resource is a file.
trans-unit.target: Specify <userInput>f</userInput> if the shared resource is a file.

trans-unit.source: This grants access to the content and metadata of the file.
trans-unit.target: This grants access to the content and metadata of the file.

trans-unit.source: Specify <userInput>s</userInput> if the shared resource is a share.
trans-unit.target: Specify <userInput>s</userInput> if the shared resource is a share.

trans-unit.source: This grants access to the content and metadata of any file in the share, and to the list of directories and files in the share.
trans-unit.target: This grants access to the content and metadata of any file in the share, and to the list of directories and files in the share.

trans-unit.source: Specifying Query Parameters to Override Response Headers (Blob Service and File Service Only)
trans-unit.target: Specifying Query Parameters to Override Response Headers (Blob Service and File Service Only)

trans-unit.source: To define values for certain response headers to be returned when the shared access signature is used in a request, you can specify response headers in query parameters.
trans-unit.target: To define values for certain response headers to be returned when the shared access signature is used in a request, you can specify response headers in query parameters.

trans-unit.source: This feature is supported beginning with version 2013-08-15 for the Blob service and version 2015-02-21 for the File service.
trans-unit.target: This feature is supported beginning with version 2013-08-15 for the Blob service and version 2015-02-21 for the File service.

trans-unit.source: Shared access signatures using this feature must include the <codeInline>sv</codeInline> parameter set to <codeInline>2013-08-15</codeInline> or later.
trans-unit.target: Shared access signatures using this feature must include the <codeInline>sv</codeInline> parameter set to <codeInline>2013-08-15</codeInline> or later.

trans-unit.source: The response headers and corresponding query parameters are as follows:
trans-unit.target: The response headers and corresponding query parameters are as follows:

trans-unit.source: Response header name
trans-unit.target: Response header name

trans-unit.source: Corresponding SAS query parameter
trans-unit.target: Corresponding SAS query parameter

trans-unit.source: For example, if you specify the <codeInline>rsct=binary</codeInline> query parameter on a shared access signature created with version 2013-08-15 or later, the <parameterReference>Content-Type</parameterReference> response header is set to <codeInline>binary</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you specify the <codeInline>rsct=binary</codeInline> query parameter on a shared access signature created with version 2013-08-15 or later, the <parameterReference>Content-Type</parameterReference> response header is set to <codeInline>binary</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: This value overrides the <parameterReference>Content-Type</parameterReference> header value stored for the blob for a request using this shared access signature only.
trans-unit.target: This value overrides the <parameterReference>Content-Type</parameterReference> header value stored for the blob for a request using this shared access signature only.

trans-unit.source: Note that if you create a shared access signature that specifies response headers as query parameters, you must include those in the string-to-sign that is used to construct the signature string.
trans-unit.target: Note that if you create a shared access signature that specifies response headers as query parameters, you must include those in the string-to-sign that is used to construct the signature string.

trans-unit.source: See the <embeddedLabel>Constructing the Signature String</embeddedLabel> section below for details, and <link xlink:href="4acc4449-8967-4701-bab5-c13f18fa7d7d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Examples of Shared Access Signatures (REST API)</link> for additional examples.
trans-unit.target: See the <embeddedLabel>Constructing the Signature String</embeddedLabel> section below for details, and <link xlink:href="4acc4449-8967-4701-bab5-c13f18fa7d7d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Examples of Shared Access Signatures (REST API)</link> for additional examples.

trans-unit.source: Specifying the Table Name (Table Service Only)
trans-unit.target: Specifying the Table Name (Table Service Only)

trans-unit.source: The <parameterReference>tablename</parameterReference> field specifies the name of the table to share.
trans-unit.target: The <parameterReference>tablename</parameterReference> field specifies the name of the table to share.

trans-unit.source: Field name
trans-unit.target: Field name

trans-unit.source: Query parameter
trans-unit.target: Query parameter

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: The name of the table to share.
trans-unit.target: The name of the table to share.

trans-unit.source: Specifying the Access Policy
trans-unit.target: Specifying the Access Policy

trans-unit.source: The access policy portion of the URI indicates the period of time over which the shared access signature is valid and the permissions to be granted to the user.
trans-unit.target: The access policy portion of the URI indicates the period of time over which the shared access signature is valid and the permissions to be granted to the user.

trans-unit.source: The parts of the URI described in the following table comprise the access policy.
trans-unit.target: The parts of the URI described in the following table comprise the access policy.

trans-unit.source: Field name
trans-unit.target: Field name

trans-unit.source: Query parameter
trans-unit.target: Query parameter

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: The time at which the shared access signature becomes valid, in an ISO 8601 format.
trans-unit.target: The time at which the shared access signature becomes valid, in an ISO 8601 format.

trans-unit.source: If omitted, start time for this call is assumed to be the time when the storage service receives the request.
trans-unit.target: If omitted, start time for this call is assumed to be the time when the storage service receives the request.

trans-unit.source: In versions before 2012-02-12, the duration between <parameterReference>signedstart</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>signedexpiry</parameterReference> cannot exceed one hour unless a container policy is used.
trans-unit.target: In versions before 2012-02-12, the duration between <parameterReference>signedstart</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>signedexpiry</parameterReference> cannot exceed one hour unless a container policy is used.

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: The time at which the shared access signature becomes invalid, in an ISO 8601 format.
trans-unit.target: The time at which the shared access signature becomes invalid, in an ISO 8601 format.

trans-unit.source: This field must be omitted if it has been specified in an associated stored access policy.
trans-unit.target: This field must be omitted if it has been specified in an associated stored access policy.

trans-unit.source: For details, see Lifetime and Revocation of a shared access signature.
trans-unit.target: For details, see Lifetime and Revocation of a shared access signature.

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: The permissions associated with the shared access signature.
trans-unit.target: The permissions associated with the shared access signature.

trans-unit.source: The user is restricted to operations allowed by the permissions.
trans-unit.target: The user is restricted to operations allowed by the permissions.

trans-unit.source: This field must be omitted if it has been specified in an associated stored access policy.
trans-unit.target: This field must be omitted if it has been specified in an associated stored access policy.

trans-unit.source: Table service only.
trans-unit.target: Table service only.

trans-unit.source: Optional, but <parameterReference>startpk</parameterReference> must accompany <parameterReference>startrk</parameterReference>.
trans-unit.target: Optional, but <parameterReference>startpk</parameterReference> must accompany <parameterReference>startrk</parameterReference>.

trans-unit.source: The minimum partition and row keys accessible with this shared access signature.
trans-unit.target: The minimum partition and row keys accessible with this shared access signature.

trans-unit.source: Key values are inclusive.
trans-unit.target: Key values are inclusive.

trans-unit.source: If omitted, there is no lower bound on the table entities that can be accessed.
trans-unit.target: If omitted, there is no lower bound on the table entities that can be accessed.

trans-unit.source: Table service only.
trans-unit.target: Table service only.

trans-unit.source: Optional, but <parameterReference>endpk</parameterReference> must accompany <parameterReference>endrk</parameterReference>.
trans-unit.target: Optional, but <parameterReference>endpk</parameterReference> must accompany <parameterReference>endrk</parameterReference>.

trans-unit.source: The maximum partition and row keys accessible with this shared access signature.
trans-unit.target: The maximum partition and row keys accessible with this shared access signature.

trans-unit.source: Key values are inclusive.
trans-unit.target: Key values are inclusive.

trans-unit.source: If omitted, there is no upper bound on the table entities that can be accessed.
trans-unit.target: If omitted, there is no upper bound on the table entities that can be accessed.

trans-unit.source: The <parameterReference>signedpermissions</parameterReference> field is required on the URI unless it is specified as part of a stored access policy.
trans-unit.target: The <parameterReference>signedpermissions</parameterReference> field is required on the URI unless it is specified as part of a stored access policy.

trans-unit.source: The <parameterReference>startpk</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>startrk</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>endpk</parameterReference>, and <parameterReference>endrk</parameterReference> fields can only be specified on a table resource.
trans-unit.target: The <parameterReference>startpk</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>startrk</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>endpk</parameterReference>, and <parameterReference>endrk</parameterReference> fields can only be specified on a table resource.

trans-unit.source: Specifying the Signature Validity Interval
trans-unit.target: Specifying the Signature Validity Interval

trans-unit.source: The <parameterReference>signedstart</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>signedexpiry</parameterReference> fields must be expressed as UTC times and must adhere to a valid ISO 8601 format.
trans-unit.target: The <parameterReference>signedstart</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>signedexpiry</parameterReference> fields must be expressed as UTC times and must adhere to a valid ISO 8601 format.

trans-unit.source: Supported ISO 8601 formats include the following:
trans-unit.target: Supported ISO 8601 formats include the following:

trans-unit.source: For the date portion of these formats, <codeInline>YYYY</codeInline> is a four-digit year representation, <codeInline>MM</codeInline> is a two-digit month representation, and <codeInline>DD</codeInline> is a two-digit day representation.
trans-unit.target: For the date portion of these formats, <codeInline>YYYY</codeInline> is a four-digit year representation, <codeInline>MM</codeInline> is a two-digit month representation, and <codeInline>DD</codeInline> is a two-digit day representation.

trans-unit.source: For the time portion, <codeInline>hh</codeInline> is the hour representation in 24-hour notation, <codeInline>mm</codeInline> is the two-digit minute representation, and <codeInline>ss</codeInline> is the two-digit second representation.
trans-unit.target: For the time portion, <codeInline>hh</codeInline> is the hour representation in 24-hour notation, <codeInline>mm</codeInline> is the two-digit minute representation, and <codeInline>ss</codeInline> is the two-digit second representation.

trans-unit.source: A time designator <codeInline>T</codeInline> separates the date and time portions of the string, while a time zone designator <codeInline>TZD</codeInline> specifies a time zone.
trans-unit.target: A time designator <codeInline>T</codeInline> separates the date and time portions of the string, while a time zone designator <codeInline>TZD</codeInline> specifies a time zone.

trans-unit.source: Specifying Permissions
trans-unit.target: Specifying Permissions

trans-unit.source: The permissions specified on the shared access signature URI indicate which operations are permitted on the shared resource.
trans-unit.target: The permissions specified on the shared access signature URI indicate which operations are permitted on the shared resource.

trans-unit.source: The following tables show the permissions supported by each resource type.
trans-unit.target: The following tables show the permissions supported by each resource type.

trans-unit.source: Permissions for a blob
trans-unit.target: Permissions for a blob

trans-unit.source: Permission
trans-unit.target: Permission

trans-unit.target: URI symbol

trans-unit.source: Allowed operations
trans-unit.target: Allowed operations

trans-unit.source: Read
trans-unit.target: Read

trans-unit.source: r
trans-unit.target: r

trans-unit.source: Read the content, properties, metadata and block list.
trans-unit.target: Read the content, properties, metadata and block list.

trans-unit.source: Use the blob as the source of a copy operation.
trans-unit.target: Use the blob as the source of a copy operation.

trans-unit.source: Write
trans-unit.target: Write

trans-unit.source: w
trans-unit.target: w

trans-unit.source: Create or write content, properties, metadata, or block list.
trans-unit.target: Create or write content, properties, metadata, or block list.

trans-unit.source: Snapshot or lease the blob.
trans-unit.target: Snapshot or lease the blob.

trans-unit.source: Resize the blob (page blob only).
trans-unit.target: Resize the blob (page blob only).

trans-unit.source: Use the blob as the destination of a copy operation within the same account.
trans-unit.target: Use the blob as the destination of a copy operation within the same account.

trans-unit.source: Delete
trans-unit.target: Delete

trans-unit.source: d
trans-unit.target: d

trans-unit.source: Delete the blob.
trans-unit.target: Delete the blob.

trans-unit.target: Permissions for a container

trans-unit.target: Read the content, properties, metadata or block list of any blob in the container.

trans-unit.target: Use any blob in the container as the source of a copy operation.

trans-unit.target: Use the blob as the destination of a copy operation within the same account.

trans-unit.target: You cannot grant permissions to read or write container properties or metadata, nor to lease a container.

trans-unit.target: Use the Process permission with Update so you can first get the message you want to update.

trans-unit.source: Permissions for a table
trans-unit.target: Permissions for a table

trans-unit.source: Permission
trans-unit.target: Permission

trans-unit.source: URI symbol
trans-unit.target: URI symbol

trans-unit.source: Allowed operations
trans-unit.target: Allowed operations

trans-unit.source: Query
trans-unit.target: Query

trans-unit.source: r (for read)
trans-unit.target: r (for read)

trans-unit.source: Get entities and query entities.
trans-unit.target: Get entities and query entities.

trans-unit.source: Add
trans-unit.target: Add

trans-unit.source: a
trans-unit.target: a

trans-unit.source: Add entities.
trans-unit.target: Add entities.

trans-unit.source: Add and Update permissions are required for upsert operations.
trans-unit.target: Add and Update permissions are required for upsert operations.

trans-unit.source: Update
trans-unit.target: Update

trans-unit.source: u
trans-unit.target: u

trans-unit.source: Update entities.
trans-unit.target: Update entities.

trans-unit.source: Add and Update permissions are required for upsert operations.
trans-unit.target: Add and Update permissions are required for upsert operations.

trans-unit.target: Delete

trans-unit.target: d

trans-unit.target: Delete entities.

trans-unit.source: Specify permissions by combining URI symbols in the <parameterReference>signedpermissions</parameterReference> field of your SAS URI.
trans-unit.target: Specify permissions by combining URI symbols in the <parameterReference>signedpermissions</parameterReference> field of your SAS URI.

trans-unit.source: Permissions can be grouped to allow multiple operations to be performed with the given signature.
trans-unit.target: Permissions can be grouped to allow multiple operations to be performed with the given signature.

trans-unit.source: You must include permissions in the order that they appear in the table for the resource type.
trans-unit.target: You must include permissions in the order that they appear in the table for the resource type.

trans-unit.source: For example, to grant all permissions to a container, the URI must specify <parameterReference>sp=rwdl</parameterReference>.
trans-unit.target: For example, to grant all permissions to a container, the URI must specify <parameterReference>sp=rwdl</parameterReference>.

trans-unit.source: To grant only read/write permissions, the URI must specify <parameterReference>sp=rw</parameterReference>.
trans-unit.target: To grant only read/write permissions, the URI must specify <parameterReference>sp=rw</parameterReference>.

trans-unit.source: Shared access signatures cannot grant access to some operations:
trans-unit.target: Shared access signatures cannot grant access to some operations:

trans-unit.source: Containers, queues, and tables cannot be created, deleted, or listed.
trans-unit.target: Containers, queues, and tables cannot be created, deleted, or listed.

trans-unit.source: Container metadata and properties cannot be read or written.
trans-unit.target: Container metadata and properties cannot be read or written.

trans-unit.source: Queues cannot be cleared and their metadata may not be written.
trans-unit.target: Queues cannot be cleared and their metadata may not be written.

trans-unit.source: Containers cannot be leased.
trans-unit.target: Containers cannot be leased.

trans-unit.source: Shared access signature URIs are keys that grant permissions to storage resources, and should be protected in the same manner as a shared key.
trans-unit.target: Shared access signature URIs are keys that grant permissions to storage resources, and should be protected in the same manner as a shared key.

trans-unit.source: Operations that use shared access signature URIs should only be performed over an HTTPS connection, and shared access signature URIs should only be distributed on a secure connection such as HTTPS.
trans-unit.target: Operations that use shared access signature URIs should only be performed over an HTTPS connection, and shared access signature URIs should only be distributed on a secure connection such as HTTPS.

trans-unit.source: Specifying Table Access Ranges
trans-unit.target: Specifying Table Access Ranges

trans-unit.source: The <parameterReference>startpk</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>startrk</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>endpk</parameterReference>, and <parameterReference>endrk</parameterReference> fields define a range of table entities associated with a shared access signature.
trans-unit.target: The <parameterReference>startpk</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>startrk</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>endpk</parameterReference>, and <parameterReference>endrk</parameterReference> fields define a range of table entities associated with a shared access signature.

trans-unit.source: Table queries will only return results that are within the range, and attempts to use the shared access signature to add, update, or delete entities outside this range will fail.
trans-unit.target: Table queries will only return results that are within the range, and attempts to use the shared access signature to add, update, or delete entities outside this range will fail.

trans-unit.source: If <parameterReference>startpk</parameterReference> equals <parameterReference>endpk</parameterReference>, the shared access signature only authorizes access to entities in one partition in the table.
trans-unit.target: If <parameterReference>startpk</parameterReference> equals <parameterReference>endpk</parameterReference>, the shared access signature only authorizes access to entities in one partition in the table.

trans-unit.source: If <parameterReference>startpk</parameterReference> equals <parameterReference>endpk</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>startrk</parameterReference> equals <parameterReference>endrk</parameterReference>, the shared access signature can only access one entity in one partition.
trans-unit.target: If <parameterReference>startpk</parameterReference> equals <parameterReference>endpk</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>startrk</parameterReference> equals <parameterReference>endrk</parameterReference>, the shared access signature can only access one entity in one partition.

trans-unit.source: Use the following table to understand how these fields constrain access to entities in a table.
trans-unit.target: Use the following table to understand how these fields constrain access to entities in a table.

trans-unit.source: Fields present
trans-unit.target: Fields present

trans-unit.source: Scope of constraint
trans-unit.target: Scope of constraint

trans-unit.source: partitionKey >= <parameterReference>startpk</parameterReference>
trans-unit.target: partitionKey >= <parameterReference>startpk</parameterReference>

trans-unit.source: <parameterReference ></parameterReference>endpk
trans-unit.target: <parameterReference ></parameterReference>endpk

trans-unit.source: partitionKey <= <parameterReference>endpk</parameterReference>
trans-unit.target: partitionKey <= <parameterReference>endpk</parameterReference>

trans-unit.source: <parameterReference>startpk</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>startrk</parameterReference>
trans-unit.target: <parameterReference>startpk</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>startrk</parameterReference>

trans-unit.source: (partitionKey > <parameterReference>startpk</parameterReference>) || (partitionKey == <parameterReference>startpk</parameterReference> && rowKey >= <parameterReference>startrk</parameterReference>)
trans-unit.target: (partitionKey > <parameterReference>startpk</parameterReference>) || (partitionKey == <parameterReference>startpk</parameterReference> && rowKey >= <parameterReference>startrk</parameterReference>)

trans-unit.source: <parameterReference>endpk</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>endrk</parameterReference>
trans-unit.target: <parameterReference>endpk</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>endrk</parameterReference>

trans-unit.source: (partitionKey < <parameterReference>endpk</parameterReference>) || (partitionKey == <parameterReference>endpk</parameterReference> && rowKey <= <parameterReference>endrk</parameterReference>)
trans-unit.target: (partitionKey < <parameterReference>endpk</parameterReference>) || (partitionKey == <parameterReference>endpk</parameterReference> && rowKey <= <parameterReference>endrk</parameterReference>)

trans-unit.source: Specifying the Signed Identifier
trans-unit.target: Specifying the Signed Identifier

trans-unit.source: Specifying the <parameterReference>signedidentifier</parameterReference> field on the URI relates the given shared access signature to a corresponding stored access policy.
trans-unit.target: Specifying the <parameterReference>signedidentifier</parameterReference> field on the URI relates the given shared access signature to a corresponding stored access policy.

trans-unit.source: A stored access policy provides an additional measure of control over one or more shared access signatures, including the ability to revoke the signature if needed.
trans-unit.target: A stored access policy provides an additional measure of control over one or more shared access signatures, including the ability to revoke the signature if needed.

trans-unit.source: Each container, queue, or table can have up to 5 stored access policies.
trans-unit.target: Each container, queue, or table can have up to 5 stored access policies.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes how to refer to a signed identifier on the URI.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes how to refer to a signed identifier on the URI.

trans-unit.source: Field name
trans-unit.target: Field name

trans-unit.source: Query parameter
trans-unit.target: Query parameter

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: A unique value up to 64 characters in length that correlates to an access policy specified for the container, queue, or table.
trans-unit.target: A unique value up to 64 characters in length that correlates to an access policy specified for the container, queue, or table.

trans-unit.source: A stored access policy includes a signed identifier, a value up to 64 characters long that is unique within the resource.
trans-unit.target: A stored access policy includes a signed identifier, a value up to 64 characters long that is unique within the resource.

trans-unit.source: The value of this signed identifier can be specified for the <parameterReference>signedidentifier</parameterReference> field in the URI for the shared access signature.
trans-unit.target: The value of this signed identifier can be specified for the <parameterReference>signedidentifier</parameterReference> field in the URI for the shared access signature.

trans-unit.source: Specifying a signed identifier on the URI associates the signature with the stored access policy.
trans-unit.target: Specifying a signed identifier on the URI associates the signature with the stored access policy.

trans-unit.source: To establish a container-level access policy using the REST API, see <link xlink:href="98f3411e-d85d-4be9-809e-135b3d4ed436" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Delegating Access with a Shared Access Signature (REST API)</link>.
trans-unit.target: To establish a container-level access policy using the REST API, see <link xlink:href="98f3411e-d85d-4be9-809e-135b3d4ed436" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Delegating Access with a Shared Access Signature (REST API)</link>.

trans-unit.source: Lifetime and Revocation of a Shared Access Signature
trans-unit.target: Lifetime and Revocation of a Shared Access Signature

trans-unit.source: Shared access signatures grant users access rights to storage account resources.
trans-unit.target: Shared access signatures grant users access rights to storage account resources.

trans-unit.source: When planning to use a shared access signature, think about the lifetime of the signature and whether your application may need to revoke access rights under certain circumstances.
trans-unit.target: When planning to use a shared access signature, think about the lifetime of the signature and whether your application may need to revoke access rights under certain circumstances.

trans-unit.source: One way that you can manage a shared access signature is to control its lifetime by setting the <parameterReference>signedexpiry</parameterReference> field of the access policy.
trans-unit.target: One way that you can manage a shared access signature is to control its lifetime by setting the <parameterReference>signedexpiry</parameterReference> field of the access policy.

trans-unit.source: If you want to continue to grant a client access to the resource after the expiry time, you must issue a new signature.
trans-unit.target: If you want to continue to grant a client access to the resource after the expiry time, you must issue a new signature.

trans-unit.source: It’s recommended that you keep the lifetime of a shared access signature short.
trans-unit.target: It’s recommended that you keep the lifetime of a shared access signature short.

trans-unit.source: Before version 2012-02-12, a shared access signature not associated with a stored access policy could not have an active period that exceeded one hour.
trans-unit.target: Before version 2012-02-12, a shared access signature not associated with a stored access policy could not have an active period that exceeded one hour.

trans-unit.source: Another way to manage a shared access signature is to associate the signature with a stored access policy.
trans-unit.target: Another way to manage a shared access signature is to associate the signature with a stored access policy.

trans-unit.source: The stored access policy is represented by the <parameterReference>signedidentifier</parameterReference> field on the URI.
trans-unit.target: The stored access policy is represented by the <parameterReference>signedidentifier</parameterReference> field on the URI.

trans-unit.source: A stored access policy provides an additional measure of control over one or more shared access signatures, including the ability to revoke the signature if needed.
trans-unit.target: A stored access policy provides an additional measure of control over one or more shared access signatures, including the ability to revoke the signature if needed.

trans-unit.source: To revoke a shared access signature that is tied to a stored access policy, you can remove the stored access policy.
trans-unit.target: To revoke a shared access signature that is tied to a stored access policy, you can remove the stored access policy.

trans-unit.source: If the storage service cannot locate the stored access policy specified in the shared access signature, the client will not be able to access the resource indicated by the URI.
trans-unit.target: If the storage service cannot locate the stored access policy specified in the shared access signature, the client will not be able to access the resource indicated by the URI.

trans-unit.source: To revoke a Shared Access signature that is not tied to a stored access policy, you must change the shared key on the storage account that was used to create the signature.
trans-unit.target: To revoke a Shared Access signature that is not tied to a stored access policy, you must change the shared key on the storage account that was used to create the signature.

trans-unit.source: Best practices recommend that a shared access signature be used together with a signed identifier that references a stored access policy, or, if no signed identifier is specified, that the interval over which the signature is valid be kept short.
trans-unit.target: Best practices recommend that a shared access signature be used together with a signed identifier that references a stored access policy, or, if no signed identifier is specified, that the interval over which the signature is valid be kept short.

trans-unit.source: For more information on associating a signature with a stored access policy, see <legacyLink xlink:href="c0d4fe58-e6f4-4a90-bad5-138f59967560" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Use a Stored Access Policy</legacyLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on associating a signature with a stored access policy, see <legacyLink xlink:href="c0d4fe58-e6f4-4a90-bad5-138f59967560" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Use a Stored Access Policy</legacyLink>.

trans-unit.source: The access policy for a shared access signature consists of the start time, expiry time, and permissions for the signature.
trans-unit.target: The access policy for a shared access signature consists of the start time, expiry time, and permissions for the signature.

trans-unit.source: You can specify all of these parameters on the signature URI and none within the stored access policy; all on the container and none on the URI; or some combination of the two.
trans-unit.target: You can specify all of these parameters on the signature URI and none within the stored access policy; all on the container and none on the URI; or some combination of the two.

trans-unit.source: However, you cannot specify a given parameter on both the signature URI and the stored access policy.
trans-unit.target: However, you cannot specify a given parameter on both the signature URI and the stored access policy.

trans-unit.source: See <legacyLink xlink:href="c0d4fe58-e6f4-4a90-bad5-138f59967560" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Use a Stored Access Policy</legacyLink> for more information.
trans-unit.target: See <legacyLink xlink:href="c0d4fe58-e6f4-4a90-bad5-138f59967560" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Use a Stored Access Policy</legacyLink> for more information.

trans-unit.source: Specifying the Signature
trans-unit.target: Specifying the Signature

trans-unit.source: The signature part of the URI is used to authenticate the request made with the shared access signature.
trans-unit.target: The signature part of the URI is used to authenticate the request made with the shared access signature.

trans-unit.source: The Blob service uses a Shared Key authentication scheme to authenticate the shared access signature.
trans-unit.target: The Blob service uses a Shared Key authentication scheme to authenticate the shared access signature.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes how to specify the signature on the URI.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes how to specify the signature on the URI.

trans-unit.source: Field name
trans-unit.target: Field name

trans-unit.source: Query parameter
trans-unit.target: Query parameter

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: The string-to-sign is a unique string constructed from the fields that must be verified in order to authenticate the request.
trans-unit.target: The string-to-sign is a unique string constructed from the fields that must be verified in order to authenticate the request.

trans-unit.source: The signature is an HMAC computed over the string-to-sign and key using the SHA256 algorithm, and then encoded using Base64 encoding.
trans-unit.target: The signature is an HMAC computed over the string-to-sign and key using the SHA256 algorithm, and then encoded using Base64 encoding.

trans-unit.source: Constructing the Signature String
trans-unit.target: Constructing the Signature String

trans-unit.source: To construct the signature string of a shared access signature, first construct the string-to-sign from the fields comprising the request, then encode the string as UTF-8 and compute the signature using the HMAC-SHA256 algorithm.
trans-unit.target: To construct the signature string of a shared access signature, first construct the string-to-sign from the fields comprising the request, then encode the string as UTF-8 and compute the signature using the HMAC-SHA256 algorithm.

trans-unit.source: Note that fields included in the string-to-sign must be URL-decoded.
trans-unit.target: Note that fields included in the string-to-sign must be URL-decoded.

trans-unit.source: Versions Prior to 2012-02-12
trans-unit.target: Versions Prior to 2012-02-12

trans-unit.source: To construct the string-to-sign for Blob service resources for versions prior to 2012-02-12, use the following format:
trans-unit.target: To construct the string-to-sign for Blob service resources for versions prior to 2012-02-12, use the following format:

trans-unit.source: Version 2012-02-12
trans-unit.target: Version 2012-02-12

trans-unit.source: To construct the string-to-sign for Blob service resources for version 2012-02-12, use the following format:
trans-unit.target: To construct the string-to-sign for Blob service resources for version 2012-02-12, use the following format:

trans-unit.source: Version 2013-08-15 or later
trans-unit.target: Version 2013-08-15 or later

trans-unit.source: To construct the string-to-sign for Blob or File service resources using the 2013-08-15 version or later, use the following format.
trans-unit.target: To construct the string-to-sign for Blob or File service resources using the 2013-08-15 version or later, use the following format.

trans-unit.source: Note that for the File service, SAS is supported beginning with version 2015-02-21.
trans-unit.target: Note that for the File service, SAS is supported beginning with version 2015-02-21.

trans-unit.source: To construct the string-to-sign for a table, use the following format:
trans-unit.target: To construct the string-to-sign for a table, use the following format:

trans-unit.source: When constructing the string to be signed, keep in mind the following:
trans-unit.target: When constructing the string to be signed, keep in mind the following:

trans-unit.source: If a field is optional and not provided as part of the request, specify an empty string for that field.
trans-unit.target: If a field is optional and not provided as part of the request, specify an empty string for that field.

trans-unit.source: Be sure to include the newline character (\n) after the empty string.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to include the newline character (\n) after the empty string.

trans-unit.source: String-to-sign for a table must include the additional parameters, even if they are empty strings.
trans-unit.target: String-to-sign for a table must include the additional parameters, even if they are empty strings.

trans-unit.source: The <codeInline>signedpermission</codeInline> portion of the string must include the permission designations in a fixed order that is specific to each resource type.
trans-unit.target: The <codeInline>signedpermission</codeInline> portion of the string must include the permission designations in a fixed order that is specific to each resource type.

trans-unit.source: Any combination of these permissions is acceptable, but the order of permission letters must match the order in the following table.
trans-unit.target: Any combination of these permissions is acceptable, but the order of permission letters must match the order in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Resource type
trans-unit.target: Resource type

trans-unit.source: Ordering of permissions
trans-unit.target: Ordering of permissions

trans-unit.source: Blob or File
trans-unit.target: Blob or File

trans-unit.source: rwd
trans-unit.target: rwd

trans-unit.source: Container or Share
trans-unit.target: Container or Share

trans-unit.source: rwdl
trans-unit.target: rwdl

trans-unit.source: Queue
trans-unit.target: Queue

trans-unit.source: raup
trans-unit.target: raup

trans-unit.source: Table
trans-unit.target: Table

trans-unit.source: raud
trans-unit.target: raud

trans-unit.source: For example, valid permissions settings for a container or share include <codeInline>rw</codeInline>, <codeInline>rd</codeInline>, <codeInline>rl</codeInline>, <codeInline>wd</codeInline>, <codeInline>wl</codeInline>, and <codeInline>rl</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: For example, valid permissions settings for a container or share include <codeInline>rw</codeInline>, <codeInline>rd</codeInline>, <codeInline>rl</codeInline>, <codeInline>wd</codeInline>, <codeInline>wl</codeInline>, and <codeInline>rl</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: Invalid settings include <codeInline>wr</codeInline>, <codeInline>dr</codeInline>, <codeInline>lr</codeInline>, and <codeInline>dw</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: Invalid settings include <codeInline>wr</codeInline>, <codeInline>dr</codeInline>, <codeInline>lr</codeInline>, and <codeInline>dw</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: Specifying a permission designation more than once is not permitted.
trans-unit.target: Specifying a permission designation more than once is not permitted.

trans-unit.source: The <codeInline>canonicalizedresouce</codeInline> portion of the string is a canonical path to the signed resource.
trans-unit.target: The <codeInline>canonicalizedresouce</codeInline> portion of the string is a canonical path to the signed resource.

trans-unit.source: It must include the service name (blob, table, queue or file) for version 2015-02-21 or later, the storage account name, and the resource name, and must be URL-decoded.
trans-unit.target: It must include the service name (blob, table, queue or file) for version 2015-02-21 or later, the storage account name, and the resource name, and must be URL-decoded.

trans-unit.source: Names of blobs must include the blob’s container.
trans-unit.target: Names of blobs must include the blob’s container.

trans-unit.source: Table names must be lower-case.
trans-unit.target: Table names must be lower-case.

trans-unit.source: The following examples show how to construct the <codeInline>canonicalizedresource</codeInline> portion of the string, depending on the type of resource.
trans-unit.target: The following examples show how to construct the <codeInline>canonicalizedresource</codeInline> portion of the string, depending on the type of resource.

trans-unit.target: Containers

trans-unit.target: For version 2015-02-21 and later:

trans-unit.target: For versions prior to 2015-02-21:

trans-unit.source: If the signed resource is a table, assure the table name is lower-case in the canonicalized format:
trans-unit.target: If the signed resource is a table, assure the table name is lower-case in the canonicalized format:

trans-unit.source: Provide a value for the <codeInline>signedidentifier</codeInline> portion of the string if you are associating the request with a stored access policy.
trans-unit.target: Provide a value for the <codeInline>signedidentifier</codeInline> portion of the string if you are associating the request with a stored access policy.

trans-unit.source: A shared access signature that specifies a storage service version before 2012-02-12 can only share a blob or container, and must omit <codeInline>signedversion</codeInline> and the newline before it.
trans-unit.target: A shared access signature that specifies a storage service version before 2012-02-12 can only share a blob or container, and must omit <codeInline>signedversion</codeInline> and the newline before it.
